dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1145 IH: Nobody Elected Elon Musk Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Stansbury (for herself and Mr. Raskin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide that the special Government employee managing the Department of Government Efficiency shall be liable for any claims against the Federal Government related to Department activities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nobody Elected Elon Musk Act.

section.header: Payment of claims against Federal Government related to Department of Government Efficiency activities
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the special Government employee (as that term is defined in section 202(a) of title 18, United States Code) managing or otherwise in charge of the Department of Government Efficiency (or any successor thereof) within the Executive Office of the President shall be liable for any claim against the Federal Government relating to activities of the Department, including claims brought as a result of violation of Federal labor laws, data privacy laws, threats to national or domestic security, Federal appropriations laws, or any other statutes.
